definitions.definition: combine (one thing) with another so that they become a whole.
examples: transportation planning should be integrated with energy policy
synonyms: homogenize; desegregate "reserve forces will be more closely integrated with the regular forces"

definitions.definition: combine (two things) so that they become a whole.
examples: the problem of integrating the two approaches

definitions.definition: (of a thing) combine with another to form a whole.
examples: the stone will blend with the environment and integrate into the landscape

definitions.definition: bring (people or groups with particular characteristics or needs) into equal participation in or membership of a social group or institution.
examples: integrating children with special needs into ordinary schools

definitions.definition: come into equal participation in or membership of society or an institution or body.
examples: she was anxious to integrate well into her husband's family

definitions.definition: desegregate (a school, neighborhood, etc.), especially racially.
examples: there was a national campaign under way to integrate the lunch counters
